intro: Jacquinia shaferi, commonly known as the Shafer's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-elevation regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals that resemble a bell, and it blooms in late summer. Jacquinia shaferi is a perennial herb that is often found in mountainous areas of California and Nevada.
